rationale: H2 scores highest on verifiability (4) because tank size is a directly manipulable variable and the data‑collection plan now includes matched‑pair schools, bias‑corrected rainfall series, and hybrid demand measurement, addressing key evidence gaps. The hypothesis isolates the effect of storage capacity, enabling clear causal inference, and is supported by modeling evidence (Vyas 2024) and blue‑water sensitivity analyses (Althoff & Destouni 2023).
citations: Modeling Rainwater Harvesting Systems with Covered Storage Tank on A Smartphone|Vikram Vyas|2024
The global freshwater system: Patterns and predictability of green‑blue water flux partitioning|Daniel Althoff, Georgia Destouni|2023
Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) Guidelines for Schools|WHO/UNICEF|2022

initial_hypothesis: Smart irrigation controllers conserve water on golf courses without reducing turf quality.
final_hypothesis: Smart irrigation controllers achieve a ≥ 15 % reduction in water use compared with conventional timer‑based controllers, and this reduction is statistically significant (p < 0.05).
rationale: H1 offers a clear, quantitative effect size that can be directly measured with the installed flow meters, has the highest verifiability rating (4), and involves lower operational complexity than turf‑quality assessments. The pilot study’s 12 % water savings provide empirical support for power calculations, making this hypothesis the most robust and testable candidate.

initial_hypothesis: Youth climate councils accelerate municipal decarbonization policy adoption.
final_hypothesis: Formally chartered youth climate councils are associated with a higher count of municipal decarbonization policies adopted within three years relative to matched cities without such councils.
rationale: This candidate is the most verifiable: it requires only counting adopted policies, avoids untested magnitude assumptions, and aligns with the identified evidence gaps while remaining testable with the available city sample.

initial_hypothesis: Collective impact tutoring models boost reading proficiency in low-income districts.
final_hypothesis: Implementing a full collective‑impact tutoring model will produce a modest increase (approximately 3‑5 points) in state‑administered reading assessment scores for Grades 3‑5 students in low‑income districts relative to matched comparison districts.
rationale: H1 offers a testable, bounded effect size supported by a systematic review of tutoring interventions (Liu 2025) and includes a concrete, hybrid fidelity measurement plan (monthly self‑surveys, quarterly observations, continuous digital logs). Its verifiability rating (3) is higher than H2’s (2), and it directly addresses the primary research question while mitigating key evidence gaps.

initial_hypothesis: Algae bioreactors integrated into buildings sequester carbon dioxide from HVAC exhaust.
final_hypothesis: Integrating an algae bioreactor into the HVAC exhaust of mid‑size commercial office buildings reduces the CO₂ concentration of the exhaust stream compared with identical buildings that lack a bioreactor.
rationale: H1 is selected because it has high verifiability—CO₂ concentration and flow can be directly measured with the defined 1‑min logging cadence, and the replication plan provides three independent rigs per condition, ensuring statistical power. The hypothesis involves a binary presence/absence variable and a clear, quantifiable outcome, minimizing evidence gaps relative to H2, which relies on unvalidated species‑specific photon‑use efficiency data.

initial_hypothesis: Sleep-tracking wearables coupled with coaching improve adolescent sleep duration.
final_hypothesis: Adolescents who receive a sleep‑tracking wearable combined with weekly video coaching will show a greater mean increase in nightly total sleep time (TST) from baseline to weeks 7‑8 than adolescents who receive the wearable alone or no intervention.
rationale: H1 offers a clear, directly testable between‑arm contrast using objective TST data, aligns with the ≥ 90 % adherence target, and requires fewer additional arms or complex mediation analyses than H2, making it more feasible and verifiable given the current resources.

initial_hypothesis: Microgrants for street vendors increase local food security in informal settlements.
final_hypothesis: Providing a US $250 unconditional micro‑grant to street‑food vendors improves the food‑security of the vendors’ own households, as reflected by higher diet quality and lower Food Insecurity Access Scale (HFIAS) scores.
rationale: H2 has the highest verifiability rating (4), a clear and well‑documented cash‑transfer pathway, and requires only standard household surveys, making it the most testable and feasible hypothesis for detecting the specified MDEs.

initial_hypothesis: Acoustic seabed monitoring detects illegal trawling more accurately than patrols.
final_hypothesis: When deployed across three 10 km² broadband sonar arrays for the 2025 fishing season, continuous acoustic seabed monitoring will achieve at least a 10 % higher true‑positive rate and a comparable false‑positive rate relative to VMS‑guided patrol observations, while detecting illegal trawls within a similar latency window.
rationale: H1 now has all verifiability requirements satisfied (≥150 ground‑truth events and a concrete ≤5 % false‑positive ceiling). Its performance targets are modest, supported by the 2023 pilot (>80 % sensitivity) and the well‑documented broadband trawl signatures (Daly & White 2020). The hypothesis involves fewer algorithmic and hardware uncertainties than H2, making it more feasible to evaluate reliably with the planned data collection and power analysis.
citations: Bottom trawling noise: Are fishing vessels polluting to deeper acoustic habitats?|Eoghan Daly, M. White|2020

initial_hypothesis: Digital twin simulations optimize manufacturing line efficiency in real time.
final_hypothesis: Implementing a continuously updated TwinForge digital‑twin that proposes scheduling adjustments every 5 minutes will increase shift‑level Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE) by 2 %–3 % on a mid‑size automotive‑components assembly line relative to the current static‑schedule baseline.
rationale: H1 targets a single, well‑defined metric (overall OEE) and has a higher verifiability score (4) than H2. Its outcome is directly measurable with the planned data‑collection plan, avoids the added complexity of isolating component‑level effects, and aligns with the pilot evidence and existing literature, making it the strongest candidate for a clear, testable evaluation.

initial_hypothesis: Rewilding former agricultural land restores pollinator populations.
final_hypothesis: Rewilding former agricultural land by removing agro‑chemicals, establishing a sequential‑flowering native wildflower strip, and allowing natural succession will restore pollinator communities, with the sequential‑flowering strip ensuring continuous floral resources throughout the season, thereby yielding higher abundance, greater species richness, and increased flower‑visitation rates than adjacent conventional fields.
rationale: This hypothesis integrates the core rewilding actions (chemical removal, habitat creation, and succession) directly addressing the research question. It is moderately verifiable (score 4) and supported by existing meta‑analyses on wildflower strips and mass‑flowering orchard heterogeneity, while the user‑provided replicate design (four 5 ha plots per treatment) and detailed landscape‑context metrics ensure robust statistical control.

initial_hypothesis: Blockchain land records reduce property disputes in rural communities.
final_hypothesis: The LandChain blockchain pilot will reduce the total number of land‑related disputes (court filings, Panchayat requests, and survey‑reported conflicts) over the 18‑month implementation period compared with the control block.
rationale: H1 directly addresses the core research question, has the highest verifiability score (4), and proposes clear, measurable outcomes using existing administrative and survey data. While it requires baseline balance checks and power analysis, its evidence gaps are more straightforward to resolve than the mediation or speed‑up hypotheses, making it the strongest candidate.

initial_hypothesis: Low-emission concrete mixes cut construction-related CO2 by 30 percent.
final_hypothesis: A low‑emission concrete mix (30 % fly ash, 20 % GGBS, 10 % recycled aggregate, clinker ≈ 55 % of cement mass, w/b = 0.45) reduces construction‑phase CO₂ emissions by at least 15 % compared with a conventional 100 % OPC mix in U.S. mid‑rise residential projects.
rationale: H2 targets a modest, evidence‑backed reduction (≥15 %) that aligns with published studies and yields a high verifiability score (≈4) after defining transport (2.68 kg CO₂/L diesel, 20 t payload) and electricity (eGRID MISO 2022 net‑generation 0.44 kg CO₂/kWh) parameters. The hypothesis is realistic, statistically testable, and supported by Akintayo et al. 2025 and Serbource et al. 2024.

initial_hypothesis: Immersive history simulations increase civic knowledge retention in middle school.
final_hypothesis: Students who experience a 30‑minute VR immersive history simulation will achieve higher immediate post‑test scores on a 20‑item civic‑knowledge quiz than those who receive a conventional lecture + textbook.
rationale: H1 provides a straightforward binary comparison, uses a validated and reliable civic‑knowledge quiz, meets a strong power requirement (180 students > 128 needed), and has a higher verifiability rating (4/5) than H2, making it the most robust candidate for automated metric scoring.

initial_hypothesis: Nutrient recovery from wastewater produces viable fertilizer for peri-urban farms.
final_hypothesis: When applied at the recommended nitrogen rate, struvite fertilizer will produce lettuce yields comparable to conventional N‑P‑K fertilizer while reducing post‑harvest soil nitrate leaching and improving overall nutrient‑use efficiency because its lower solubility limits rapid nitrogen loss.
rationale: H2 extends the core efficacy test (yield parity) with a clear sustainability benefit (lower nitrate leaching and higher nutrient‑use efficiency). This aligns with the research goal, leverages available lysimeter infrastructure, and addresses a high‑impact knowledge gap. Although it adds operational complexity, the proposed measurement plan (lysimeters, ion chromatography, rain‑out shelters) makes the hypothesis fully testable, and supporting literature (Leon 2023; Rupp 2024) provides precedent for reduced N losses with struvite.

final_hypothesis: Solar‑powered cold storage reduces post‑harvest loss by ≥ 10 percentage points (≈ 45 % relative reduction) compared with diesel‑generated ice boxes and no cooling, delivering an average economic gain of ≥ US $30 per fisher per month.
rationale: H1 received the highest verifiability score (5) and offers a clear, policy‑relevant effect size that is detectable with realistic sample sizes. initial_hypothesis: Haptic feedback gloves improve accuracy in remote robotic surgery.
final_hypothesis: Haptic‑feedback gloves reduce positional error in remote robotic surgery compared with standard non‑feedback gloves.
rationale: H1 has the highest verifiability (5/5) with all variables directly measurable and a within‑subject design that controls for surgeon skill. It addresses a clear, single outcome (positional error) with minimal methodological complexity, reducing risk of confounds and ensuring robust automated metric scoring. Supporting pilot data and literature demonstrate a measurable accuracy benefit, making this hypothesis the most feasible and reliable for the planned dataset.
